name: TextureStyleOptions
description: This takes a shader string and maps it to a resource id. This is a little different than regular resource ids as these ids are not unique to the resource. But must not overlap with other (non sampler) resources Ids. / function createResourceIdFromString(value: string): number { const id = idHash[value]; if (id === undefined) { idHash[value] = uid('resource'); } return id; } /** The options for the texture style.

properties.name: addressMode
properties.description: setting this will set wrapModeU,wrapModeV and wrapModeW all at once!

properties.name: addressModeU
properties.description: specifies the {{GPUAddressMode|address modes}} for the texture width, height, and depth coordinates, respectively.

properties.name: addressModeV
properties.description: specifies the {{GPUAddressMode|address modes}} for the texture width, height, and depth coordinates, respectively.

properties.name: addressModeW
properties.description: Specifies the {{GPUAddressMode|address modes}} for the texture width, height, and depth coordinates, respectively.

properties.name: scaleMode
properties.description: setting this will set magFilter,minFilter and mipmapFilter all at once!

properties.name: magFilter
properties.description: specifies the sampling behavior when the sample footprint is smaller than or equal to one texel.

properties.name: minFilter
properties.description: specifies the sampling behavior when the sample footprint is larger than one texel.

properties.name: mipmapFilter
properties.description: specifies behavior for sampling between mipmap levels.

properties.name: lodMinClamp
properties.description: specifies the minimum and maximum levels of detail, respectively, used internally when sampling a texture.

properties.name: lodMaxClamp
properties.description: Specifies the minimum and maximum levels of detail, respectively, used internally when sampling a texture.

properties.name: compare
properties.description: When provided the sampler will be a comparison sampler with the specified {@link COMPARE_FUNCTION}. Note: Comparison samplers may use filtering, but the sampling results will be implementation-dependent and may differ from the normal filtering rules.

properties.name: maxAnisotropy
properties.description: Specifies the maximum anisotropy value clamp used by the sampler. Note: Most implementations support {@link TextureStyle#maxAnisotropy} values in range between 1 and 16, inclusive. The used value of {@link TextureStyle#maxAnisotropy} will be clamped to the maximum value that the platform supports. setting this to anything higher than 1 will set scale modes to 'linear'

properties.name: change
Note
properties.type:
Comparison samplers may use filtering, but the sampling results will be
     * implementation-dependent and may differ from the normal filtering rules.
     */
    public compare?: COMPARE_FUNCTION

properties.name: Note
properties.type:
Most implementations support {@link TextureStyle#maxAnisotropy} values in range
     * between 1 and 16, inclusive. The used value of {@link TextureStyle#maxAnisotropy} will
     * be clamped to the maximum value that the platform supports.
     * @internal
     */
    public _maxAnisotropy?: number = 1
